Html:
Hi everyone! Because some software updates need to kill iexplorer or whatever programs to install correctly, i would like for some of them be installed on starting up/shutting down or logging on/logging off. Is it possible?

In ordinary Windows Updates it sometimes does background updates when starting up and so. I would not like to use a custom-created update with scripts and bells and whistles - i'd like to use the ordinary updates.

EvarRing wrote:
Hi everyone! Because some software updates need to kill iexplorer or whatever programs to install correctly, i would like for some of them be installed on starting up/shutting down or logging on/logging off. Is it possible?
Yes, it is possible. You can use CostumUpdates. Have a look in documentation: https://wsuspackagepublisher.codeplex.com/documentation
Unfortunately, I never found any solution to ensure that an update only install at shutdown. I still search a trick.
